result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Defendant Thomas James Beck not in court.  Attorney David Allan Nelson in court for Thomas James Beck.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses letter, Doc. 5.  State does not make a particular motion and victim does not appear and object to the request.  Atty. Nelson states has not spoken with the defendant and unable to review discovery due to technical issues and working with DA Office.  Court states if there will be a request for bond modification the victim must appear as court would like to hear from the victim.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on December 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Thomas James Beck by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  State requests $300.00 cash bond.  Court orders $2,500.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
